messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Shouldn't it be called Alan Rickman day?
messages.msgSnippet: ... The Church of Rickman declares this day (and all the others) to be Alan Rickman Day. I haven t seen it yet. We re going Monday after the stampede is over.
messages.messageBody:
On 15 Nov 02, at 13:34, Dnowens@... wrote:

> Harry Potter comes out today. We are all going, even though I had to
> half threaten Moly if she mentioned even one more thing about the
> movie, she wouldn't go. I do believe that between the books, the
> commercial teasers, the web site (s), Jay Leno, and all the others,
> Moly knows exactly what is going to happen, what is in the movie that
> isn't in the book and what is in the book. And she has told us all at
> least a thousand times a day for the past three or more weeks.
>
> So here I am, taking a break from cleaning the house to check my mail,
> and wish you all a happy Harry Potter (I mean Alan Rickman) day!
>
> ~Nancy

The Church of Rickman declares this day (and all the others) to be
Alan Rickman Day.
I haven't seen it yet. We're going Monday after the stampede is
over. I'm sure DD will sit through it and complain about which bits
are different from the book. She did with the first one.
>
> PS. Shryley, My Mom sent me a box of birthday gifts, one was a book
> called The Grand Canyon and the Southwest. It is full of beautiful
> photographs by Ansel Adams. I love his work, and had a thought you
> might like his work too. You should go see if your library has any
> copies of his collection in books.

Coo. I'll have to have a gander. I'm trying to fix my camera at the
moment so we can take pics too. The windy on thingy ain't
working. Thats as bout as technical as I get :-)

Shyrley



"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning]Shouldn't it be called Alan Rickman day?
messages.msgSnippet: Harry Potter comes out today. We are all going, even though I had to half threaten Moly if she mentioned even one more thing about the movie, she wouldn t go.
messages.messageBody:
Harry Potter comes out today. We are all going, even though I had to half
threaten Moly if she mentioned even one more thing about the movie, she
wouldn't go. I do believe that between the books, the commercial teasers, the
web site (s), Jay Leno, and all the others, Moly knows exactly what is going
to happen, what is in the movie that isn't in the book and what is in the
book. And she has told us all at least a thousand times a day for the past
three or more weeks.

So here I am, taking a break from cleaning the house to check my mail, and
wish you all a happy Harry Potter (I mean Alan Rickman) day!

~Nancy

PS. Shryley, My Mom sent me a box of birthday gifts, one was a book called
The Grand Canyon and the Southwest. It is full of beautiful photographs by
Ansel Adams. I love his work, and had a thought you might like his work too.
You should go see if your library has any copies of his collection in books.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
